snippet: The bookstore, which has been in business since 1977, was in danger of closing because of declining sales and rising rent.
abstract: St Marks Bookshop signs lease on new space at 136 East Third Street in Manhattan's East Village; bookstore, which has been in business in neighborhood since 1977, was in danger of closing due to declining sales and rising rent.
lead_paragraph: The bookstore, which has been in business since 1977, was in danger of closing because of declining sales and rising rent.

headline.main: St. Mark’s Bookshop in East Village Signs Lease on New Location
headline.print_headline: St. Marks Bookshop to Move, but Will Stay in East Village
